Detailed Description

Provides Methods and constants for operations on MySQL Tables

Definition at line 36 of file MySQLTable.php.

Member Function Documentation

MySQLTable::__construct (  $  table,
MySQLConnection $  connection,
&$  errors
) 
 

Initialises MySQLTable for the table named $table on the given $connection.

Parameters:
$table name of the table
$connection BDDConnection for all table operations. This must be a valid and connected BDDConnection unless it will cause an Error.
$errors reference to an Errors object. It will be set if an error occurs during instanciation. If operation was successful, it equals NULL

MySQLTable::bDDRecordToTableRecord (  BDDRecord $  record  )  [protected]
 

Computes conversion from a standard BDDRecord to a safe BDDRecord for MySQL queries. It also computes an intersection between table fields and BDDRecord properties.

Returns:
a BDDRecord ready to be saved/updated into table

MySQLTable::Select (  $  fields,
$  options
) 
 

Computes a selection of $fields on entries that correspond to $options

Parameters:
$fields array of string that reprensents fields' name to select
$options string that contains various select options like "where", "order", "limit", ...
Returns:
- a BDDRecordSet that contains BDDRecord-s ( Database entries) if select was successful

- an Errors object in case of error(s) : see BDDConnectionInterface::Query

See also:
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/select.html

Implements BDDTableInterface.

$  clause
)
